in.basulabs.audiofocuscontroller

Class AudioFocusController

  • java.lang.Object
    • in.basulabs.audiofocuscontroller.AudioFocusController
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    android.media.AudioManager.OnAudioFocusChangeListener

    public final class AudioFocusController
extends java.lang.Object
implements android.media.AudioManager.OnAudioFocusChangeListener
    A class to help you manage audio focus in your app without writing too many lines of code.

    After you have imported this library to your project, first build an instance of this class using the AudioFocusController.Builder class. You must set the context, the duration hint and the AudioFocusController.OnAudioFocusChangeListener instance.

    Once you have built the instance, you are ready to go. Every time before starting playback, call requestFocus(). If Android grants focus, you will receive a callback in AudioFocusController.OnAudioFocusChangeListener.resume() method. If focus is lost, whether for some time or permanently, the AudioFocusController.OnAudioFocusChangeListener.pause() method will be called. If the system grants delayed focus, then AudioFocusController.OnAudioFocusChangeListener.resume() method will be called when the system finally grants focus. If focus request is denied, no method will be called.

    Remember that whenever you start the playback, always call requestFocus() and wait for the AudioFocusController.OnAudioFocusChangeListener.resume() method to be called. When you pause the playback, make sure you call abandonFocus() so that the focus can be freed for other apps.

    • Method Detail

      • requestFocus

        public void requestFocus()
        Requests audio focus from the system.

        This function should be called every time you want to start/resume playback. If the system grants focus, you will get a call in AudioFocusController.OnAudioFocusChangeListener.resume().

        If the system issues delayed focus, or rejects the request, then no callback will be issued. However, once the system grants full focus after delayed focus has been issued, the AudioFocusController.OnAudioFocusChangeListener.resume() method will be called.

      • abandonFocus

        public void abandonFocus()
        Abandons audio focus.

        Call this method every time you stop/pause playback. This will free audio focus for other apps.

      • onAudioFocusChange

        public void onAudioFocusChange(int focusChange)
        Specified by:
        onAudioFocusChange in interface android.media.AudioManager.OnAudioFocusChangeListener
